meanings.definition: Lacking intelligence or good judgment; foolish.
meanings.sent1: She made a softheaded decision without thinking it through.
meanings.sent2: He often acts softheaded when he doesn't listen to advice.
meanings.sent3: The softheaded squirrel tried to store acorns in the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her softheaded idea to swim with sharks left everyone concerned.
meanings.sent5: The softheaded mistake cost him the game.

meanings.definition: Having a weak or easily influenced mind.
meanings.sent1: The softheaded child believed everything he was told.
meanings.sent2: She felt softheaded after watching the scary movie.
meanings.sent3: The softheaded puppy followed anyone who offered treats.
meanings.sent4: His softheaded mind was swayed by the flashy advertisement.
meanings.sent5: The softheaded student copied the wrong answers on the test.
